sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A letter of the surrender of Sterling-Castle, vvith 5000 arms, 40 peece of ordnance, provision for 500, men for above a yeare, 30 barrels of claret and strong-water, 26 barrels of powder, all the records of Scotland, with the chaire, cloath, and sword of state, and much furniture of the Kings and Parliament robes. VVith the articles at large for surrender of the same. Published by speciall order.
8 p.
Printed for Francis Leach, London : 1651.
A variant has "peeces" in line 6, and "provisions" in line 7. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug. 28". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A letter of the surrender of Sterling-Castle, vvith 5000 arms, 40 peece of ordnance, provision for 500, men for above a yeare, 30 barrels of claret and strong-water, 26 barrels of powder, all the records of Scotland, with the chaire, cloath, and sword of state, and much furniture of the Kings and Parliament robes. VVith the articles at large for surrender of the same. Published by speciall order.
8 p.
Printed for Francis Leach, London : 1651.
A variant has "peeces" in line 6, and "provisions" in line 7. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug. 28". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Francis Leach
>>>>>>> imprintparse
